)

calculate the local-space to texture-space transform. The tangent and binormal must not be normalized, and p0 and tc0 are a position and texture-coordinate that come from a vertex.

determine the inverse scales for the tangent and binormal.

create tangents that contain the inverse scales so that we can go into texture space at the proper scale.

create a rotation that maps us into texture space as X = U, Y = V, and Z = W.

now determine the translation.
